clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Cordio App in Adult Patients With CHF
clinical_study.official_title: Single-Arm Observational Double - Blind Study Designed to Clinically Evaluate Cordio Application in Adult Patients With CHF

brief_summary.textblock: Observational study on CHF patients at one site in Israel. After signing informed consent and undergoing screening assessments, eligible patients will record a sentence and/or counting into a smartphone and/or recording machine. The app will upload the vocal data to the sponsor's servers for analysis.The study will include a screening phase in the hospital, according to the inclusion and exclusion criteria. After signing informed consent and undergoing screening assessments, eligible patients will record a sentence and/or counting into a recording machine. The patient will record at hospital admittance, during hospitalization and at release. Before hospital release, if applicable, an app will be installed in their smart phone in order to continue the recording at home.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of NYHA Class II or III HF.
- In hospital after Heart Failure Related (HFR) hospitalization.
- Able to understand and provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects unable to comply with the daily use of the application due to mental disorders.
- Subjects who have had a major cardiovascular event within 2 months of Screening Visit.
- GFR <25 ml/min who are non-responsive to diuretic therapy or who are on chronic renal dialysis.
- Women who are pregnant or lactating.
